title: Francesco Farioli - Wikipedia
snippet: Francesco Farioli (Italian pronunciation: [faˈrjɔːli]; born 10 April 1989) is an Italian football manager. He is currently the head coach of Primeira Liga club Porto. Farioli started his coaching career in Turkey with spells at Fatih Karagümrük and Alanyaspor. He then had one season in ...

title: Foreign coaches in Mokum | All of Farioli's predecessors
snippet: The last foreign coach for Ajax was the Dane Olsen, who held the reins during the 1997-1998 season. Under his leadership, Ajax won both the national championship and the Dutch Cup.

title: Liverpool assistant manager John Heitinga appointed Ajax head coach - The Athletic
snippet: Heitinga is replacing Francesco Farioli at the Amsterdam club, who narrowly missed out on this season’s Eredivisie title to PSV Eindhoven.

title: Francesco Farioli new Ajax head coach
snippet: The Italian studied philosophy before entering the world of football. He began his career as a goalkeeping coach under Roberto De Zerbi and took his first steps as a head coach in Turkey at the age of thirty.

title: Ajax: Francesco Farioli leaves club after title miss agony - BBC Sport
snippet: Ajax technical director Alex Kroes said, despite missing out on the title, the club had achieved its aim of qualifying for the Champions League under Farioli and found his departure "incredibly disappointing".
